If you have no colonies to return your researching ships to when you complete this tech, you may immediately use this tech to gain your new colony using all of those ships.
Once completed, this tech stays in play. While it is in play,
hen you lose an encounter as the defense by 5 or less, one of your ships may remain on the planet instead of going to the warp.
Your ship coexists with any ships that establish a colony on the planet during the encounter.

ou may discard this tech at the start of any encounter. Each player, starting with you and continuing clockwise, either draws cards from the deck or discards cards at random as needed to bring his or her hand to exactly eight cards. You (and only you) may discard as many of your cards as you wish beforehand.
Do not reveal this tech until used. You may reveal and discard this tech at the start of any
encounter to take the Genesis planet and place it in your home system. You may immediately gain a colony on it using any or all of the ships used to research this tech.

. Afterwards, play resumes from where it left off.
When you complete this tech, take and place the lunar cannon token between two of your home planets. While this tech is in play, you control the lunar cannon.

ally, you may add 10 to your side's total in any encounters targeting a world next to the lunar cannon. Each time a wild destiny card is drawn, you may move the lunar cannon token to a new position in any system.
ou may discard this tech at the start of any encounter to choose a planet in any system. Remove that planet from the game and send all ships on it to the warp.

When you complete this tech, take the Prometheus token and place it on one of your colonies. While this tech is in play, you control the Prometheus, which is treated in all ways as one of your ships except that it adds an extra +3 to your side's total when it

Do not reveal this tech until used. You may reveal and discard this tech at any time to cancel the effect of any one other tech card. The canceled tech must have a research cost equal
or less than the number of ships researching this tech. The canceled tech is discarded
ou may discard this tech at the start of any encounter to draw four cards from the deck. Look at them and add any of them you wish to your hand, discarding the rest.

all of your ships from the warp. Freed ships return to any of your colonies.
Once completed, this tech stays in play. While it is in play,
As a main player or ally,
you may either add 1 to, or subtract 1 from, your side's total
after encounter cards are revealed when you are a main player or ally
After destiny is drawn, you may reset this tech to discard that destiny card. If you do, the offense draws another destiny card.
You can play more than one flare card per encounter. (Each flare can be played only once per encounter.)
During the regroup phase, you may discard this tech to free one of your ships from the warp.
You may discard an alien's flare to cancel one use of that alien's power. That power cannot be used again during this encounter. (This is not treated as a Cosmic Zap.)
At any time, you may send one ship belonging to another player from a colony to the warp. If you do, reset this tech and give it to that player.
During the regroup phase, you may discard this tech to draw three space station cards (even if the Space Station variant [13]
is not being used). Choose one to put into play in your home system and shuffle the other back into the space station deck.
At any time, you may reset this tech to free all of your ships from the warp.

You cannot complete this tech.

During the reveal phase, if a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech. For each ship on it, add 3 to one side's total. Then, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.

You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to choose a planet. For each ship on this tech, send one ship to the warp from the chosen planet. Then, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.

You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to choose one or more techs; a tech that has more ships on it than this tech cannot be chosen. All ships on the chosen techs return to their owner's colonies. Then, discard this tech, send all ships on it to the warp, and draw another tech.

You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to reveal all flares in the discard pile an in each other player's hand. For each ship on this tech, take one revealed flare of your choice and add it to your hand. This, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.

You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to choose a player. For each ship on this tech, that player discards a card at random from their hand. Then, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.

You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to shuffle either the cosmic or the reward deck discard pile. For each ship on this tech, draw a card from that discard pile. Then, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.
Discard at any time. If you do, each other play must discard all non-encounter cards from their hand or lose eight ships to the warp.
As a main player or ally, after
cards are revealed, you may discard any number of cards at random from your hand. For each card you discarded, add 3 to your total.

When a player plays a wild flare, if you have a colony in that player's home system, you may send one of your ships from that colony to the warp to cancel the flare and return it to that player's hand. (Each flare can be played only once per encounter.)
After card are revealed, you may play this tech, treating it as a +5 reinforcement card. After that encounter is resolved, discard this tech to the tech discard pile.

During the planning phase of an encounter in your home system, any player with a colony on the targeted planet may play a card faceup next to the hyperspace gate. If the main player makes a deal, the offense gains those cards. Otherwise, each card adds 3 to the defense's total, and the defense gains them at the end of the reveal phase.

Add the Reward Deck variant (10) to the game. If it is already being used, or if you discarded attack cards with a total value of at least 21, add the Ultra Reward Deck sub-variant. Then, discard this tech and draw two reward cards.

At any time, you may place one flare faceup from your hand on this tech. This flare can be played, cannot be canceled, and is not part of your hand. (When this card is played, it returns to your hand like normal.) You may discard the flare on this tech at any time. If you need to draw a new hand, you must first discard the flare on this tech.
, you may give this tech faceup to a main player. They must invite you.
When more than one of your ships would be sent to the wapr, you may send one of them to any of your colonies instead.
When you draw a new hand, you may draw one additional card.
Before encounter cards are selected, you may take a card at random from another player's hand. If you do, reset this tech and give it to that player.
Reset this tech to cancel one use of any alien's power, including your own. That power cannot be used again during this encounter. (This is treated as a Cosmic Zap, but is not an artifact.)
